acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since its 96h LC50 = 1.7 mg/L for fish (rainbow trout) (Aquire 2009), the substance was classified into Category 2.

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on its rabbit LD50 value of 2025 mg/kg (EHC 64, 1986), the substance was classified into "Not classified" using the JIS classification criteria (Category 5 in the United Nations classification).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Although its rat LC50 of > 7.4 mg/L (Gangolli (2nd Ed. 1999)) has been documented, the value is based on List 3 dataset and thus, the substance was classified into "Classification not possible". Since its saturated vapour pressure concentration is 4.82*10^-8mg/L, it was judged that the test was conducted using dust.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on its rat LD50 value of 10250 mg/kg (EHC 64, 1986), the substance was classified into "Not classified".

carcinogenicity.rationale: In carcinogenicity tests using rats or mice that underwent mixed diet administration, no carcinogenicity was detected (Pesticide Safety Information (Japan Crop Protection Association), original literature: FOOD SANITATION RESEARCH vol. 51, No. 8). This result indicates that the substance is to be placed into "Not classified" category, but the result is based on a List 2 dataset; thus, the substance was classified into "Classification not possible".

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since its classification for acute toxicity is Category 2, and no datasets on its rapid degradability are available, the substance was classified into Category 2.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available.

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Neither in vivo data nor positive results in in vitro mutagenicity tests using several indices are available, classification is not possible. Also, negative results were gathered in in vitro mutagenicity tests including Ames tests and chromosomal aberration tests using human lymphocytes (Pesticide Safety Information (Japan Crop Protection Association), original literature: FOOD SANITATION RESEARCH vol. 51, No. 8)

organic_peroxides.rationale: Organic compounds containing no bivalent -O-O- structure

oxidizing_solids.rationale: The substance contains oxygen which is chemically bonded only to carbon or hydrogen.

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Negative results were obtained in both 2-generation reproductive tests using rats and teratogenicity tests using rats or chinchilla rabbits (Pesticide Safety Information (Japan Crop Protection Association), original literature: FOOD SANITATION RESEARCH vol. 51, No. 8). These results indicate that the substance is to be placed into "Not classified" category, but the result is based on a List 2 dataset; thus, the substance was classified into "Classification not possible".

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid (melting point <= 140degC) substances are not available.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups present in the molecule associated with explosive or self-reactive properties.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (blood system)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: In combined studies of repeated administration and carcinogenicity tests using rats, a tendency to anemia, and increase in reticulocytes and hemoglobin were observed in animal groups treated with 300 ppm (conversion value: 16 mg/kg/day) or higher (Pesticide Safety Information (Japan Crop Protection Association), original literature: FOOD SANITATION RESEARCH vol. 51, No. 8 (2001)). Thus, the substance was classified into Category 2 (blood system).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
